reason: The statement references 'Lemma 11.3 (tail in block implies support in block)' but the actual Lemma 11.3 as defined states: 'If n >= 1 and g_1(B) = B for block B containing a_1, then supp(g_1) is contained in B.' The informal gloss 'tail in block implies support in block' is a reasonable summary but slightly imprecise since Lemma 11.3 specifically concerns g_1 and a_1, not arbitrary 'tails'. Consider using the precise lemma statement or noting that this is a specific instance of the more general Lemma 11.2 applied to g_1.
